intro: Tephrosia djalonica, commonly known as African tephrosia, is a leguminous plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant is often found in moist, wooded areas and is adapted to thrive in humid climates. It has a deep root system that helps it access water and nutrients from deeper soil layers. Tephrosia djalonica is also valued for its potential in soil enrichment due to its nitrogen-fixing ability.
